intro: Anthriscus scandicina, commonly known as the creeping cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family (Apiaceae). Anthriscus scandicina thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
